benchmark_details.name: DABstep (Data Agent Benchmark for Multi-step Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: DABstep is a novel benchmark for evaluating AI agents on realistic multi-step data analysis tasks, comprising over 450 real-world challenges derived from a financial analytics platform, requiring models to combine code-based data processing with contextual reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of DABstep is to rigorously evaluate AI agents on realistic, multi-step data analysis tasks.

data.source: Tasks are derived from operational workloads at Adyen, including real financial analytics tasks.
data.annotation: Tasks were curated based on real internal queries, ensuring diverse data manipulation and contextual understanding.

methodology.calculation: Tasks are scored based on a binary correctness evaluation of factoid answers.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates capable multi-step reasoning and data manipulation abilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Top models achieved 14.55% accuracy on Hard tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation against a hidden test set to ensure robust generalization capabilities.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymized datasets have been used to ensure privacy.
